block.p: Karina Rhea Bozzuto, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James C. Bozzuto of Avon, Conn., was married yesterday on Martha's Vineyard to Daniel Edwin Weiss Jr., the son of the Rev. Dr. Daniel Edwin Weiss and Mrs. Weiss of Marco Island, Fla. The bridegroom's father, an American Baptist minister, performed the ceremony at the Federated Church in Edgartown, Mass.

Karina Rhea Bozzuto, the daughter of Dr. and Mrs. James C. Bozzuto of Avon, Conn., was married yesterday on Martha's Vineyard to Daniel Edwin Weiss Jr., the son of the Rev. Dr. Daniel Edwin Weiss and Mrs. Weiss of Marco Island, Fla. The bridegroom's father, an American Baptist minister, performed the ceremony at the Federated Church in Edgartown, Mass.

Mrs. Weiss, 25, is to begin her first-year studies at the University of Louisville School of Medicine next month. She graduated from Brown University and is a clinical research associate at Alkermes Inc., a biotechnology company in Cambridge, Mass. Her father, a psychiatrist, has a private practice in Hartford, and is an assistant clinical professor of psychiatry at the University of Connecticut School of Medicine in Farmington. Her mother, Donna M. Bozzuto, is an elementary school libarian for the Southington, Conn., public schools.

Mr. Weiss, 33, is the assistant counsel at Atex Media Solutions, a maker of hardware and software for the publishing industry in Bedford, Mass. He graduated from Eastern College in St. David's, Pa., and the Pepperdine University School of Law. His father, a former president of Eastern College and of Eastern Baptist Theological Seminary in Philadelphia, is the general secretary of American Baptist Churches in the U.S.A., the national organization for the denomination. His mother, Rachel A. Weiss, retired last year from Delaware County Community College in Media, Pa., where she tutored international students.
